titles.title: A bill to increase the Federal Housing Administration mortgage commitment level to carry out the purposes of section 203(b) of the National Housing Act.
A bill to increase the Federal Housing Administration mortgage commitment level to carry out the purposes of section 203(b) of the National Housing Act.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Housing and Community Opportunity.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)
Increases the Federal Housing Administration FY 2003 mortgage insurance commitment level under the National Housing Act to $185 billion (currently $165 billion).
